subject: My Dear,
body:
My Dear,
There's a PTC (Payment Transaction Case) which is open in a fund
management company because the owner is now deceased and there's no
clear next of kin to inherit the PTC involving $15.3m.
As a financial consultant working in the fund management company, I
propose that we work together to clear the PTC funds.
This is totally 100% risk-free 
and would be mutually beneficial.
That's all the detail I can divulge for now until I receive your
positive reply and I can expatiate further.
Do please reply to: 
benchuma60@gmail.com
Kind regards,
Mr. Ben Chuma

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Hello Mr. Ben Chuma,

I hope this message finds you well. Your proposal sounds intriguing, although I must admit, I'm not entirely familiar with the concept of a PTC Payment Case. Could you perhaps explain it to me in simpler terms? 

Also, how did you come across my contact information? And what would be my role in this process?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Christopher

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Hello Christopher,



Thanks for your response as I will provide you with more details as
demanded.

I sincerely advise you to have confidence and trust in this transaction
because it is 100% risk free and gainful for us. I will once more highlight
you on more details and insight of this transaction below.


I am an auditor with the Micro Finance bank, I stumbled upon a
long-inactive deposit of a deceased client of this firm. Therefore, you
might be related either from a very long genealogy or distant descendants
but one thing that is very important is the common surname that I
will enclose in the processing of this transaction.

Dear, I propose you to cooperate with me in seeing that the funds ($15.3M
USD) of the Late Engr. Khan Verma does not go to the government’s treasury
as unclaimed estates which are called (Bona Vacantia) meaning Ownerless
Property because *there is no Will or Next of Kin as the firm has tried to
find someone remotely related to the late Engr Verma.*

Christopher, this is the reasons i asked you to facilitate me with all your
basic details such as:





*FULL NAMESHOME MAILING ADDRESSTEL/FAX NUMBERS OCCUPATIONAGE *

As an insider, I’ve all facts/details about the deposit of our late client
which will help to facilitate the approval of your claims and release of
the deposit to your nominated bank account.

I will appreciate your cooperation.
Best regards,

Ben Chuma.

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Hello Ben Chuma,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite an interesting situation you've found yourself in, and I'm intrigued by the story of Engr. Khan Verma. 

I must admit, I'm not very familiar with these types of situations. Could you perhaps explain a bit more about how this process works? How is it possible that such a large sum of money could go unclaimed?

Also, I'm curious about your role as an auditor in all this. What exactly does your job entail in relation to this case?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Christopher

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Dear Christopher,
Thanks for your response and very open up to issues that concerns this
transaction.

Sir, not all knows and have heard about this before, but it exists and is
ongoing in various sectors, is all about the ability to keep it completely
confidential and play by the rules with every honesty, sincerity and
dedication.
Christopher, once I have your information, I will use it to prepare a
Memorandum of Agreement between us based on the percentage and method of
sharing and also making sure we all play by the rule with every sincerity
and honesty to each other.

After that, I will seek the services of an attorney who will go to the
court to secure some documents and already I have pulled the certificate of
deposit of the funds that will be presented to the bank for immediate
approval and release of the funds to you as the sole beneficiary and Next
of Kin to the Late Engr. Khan.

Sir, this money has been with the bank for many years and they have been
searching for the relatives and no one has ever come along to claim it and
there is a certain period of years the bank can search before the will stop
and calls-in the funds as an Unclaimed funds then share it within the
directors.

Sir, as an insider, I strongly believe it is possible and workable as long
as you keep everything confidential, follow my instructions and be honest,
open heart with me in every step of this transaction and especially when
the funds enter into your any nominated bank account.

I think I have given you a preview of the transaction as I look forward to
hearing from you.
Regards,
Ben.

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Hello Ben,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must admit, this is all very new to me and I'm trying my best to understand it all. 

So, if I understood correctly, the bank has been holding onto these funds for a while now and they've been unable to locate any relatives of the late Engr. Khan? That's quite unfortunate.

You mentioned about preparing a Memorandum of Agreement between us. Could you please elaborate more on what this agreement would entail? Also, how does the process of securing documents from court work?

I appreciate your assurance about keeping everything confidential and being honest throughout this process. However, I'm curious as to why no one else has come forward to claim these funds yet? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christopher

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Dear Christopher,
Yes, in some cases, people may have issues with their families and decide
not to reveal or notify anyone. In another experience, people may die by
accident without properly writing their wills (in all these there are
possibilities).
The Agreement is what binds us as partners, because the funds will be
coming into your account and must be used for what we planned for which is
Real Estate and Hotel management. Also, we have to agree on sharing
modalities and keep to it, because once the money enters your account, we
must invest it.

Sir, documents that will cover you and the transaction will be secured,
through the court process, because I will seek the attention of an attorney
that will do the work and do it perfectly. We each hold the confidence of
making this transaction a reality by being honest, open hearted with
information and dedicated.
Regards,
Ben.

subject: Re: My Dear,
body:
Hello Ben,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's fascinating to learn about the intricacies of these processes. I'm particularly interested in the part where you mentioned about the agreement that binds us as partners. Could you please elaborate more on this? What exactly does it entail?

Also, you mentioned about investing in Real Estate and Hotel. That sounds like a promising venture! Could you share more details about this? How do we go about it and what are the potential returns we can expect?

Lastly, regarding the attorney who will handle all legal matters, how do we ensure everything is done perfectly as per law? Is there any way to verify their credentials?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Christopher
